series_info.series_name: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN
series_info.original_source: Naval History and Heritage Command, Papers of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN, Coll. 505, Series I, Subseries A

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 0
books.subtitle: Complete Table of Contents, Historical Commentary, and Master Index
books.author: Naval History and Heritage Command
books.description: Master guide to the complete 8-volume Nimitz Graybook collection. Includes comprehensive table of contents with all 297 bookmarks, historical context essays on the Pacific War, guide to using the collection, master index, and publisher's commentary on the digitization and preservation effort.

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 1
books.subtitle: 7 December 1941 to 31 August 1942
books.author: Captain James M. Steele, USN (CINCPAC Staff)
books.period_covered: Pearl Harbor through early Guadalcanal campaign
books.description: Running estimate and summary maintained by Captain James M. Steele, USN, covering the critical first nine months of WWII in the Pacific: Pearl Harbor, Wake Island, Doolittle Raid, Coral Sea, and Midway. Contains CINCPAC staff's running estimate of the situation, command decisions, and key dispatches.

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 2
books.subtitle: 1 September 1942 to 31 December 1942
books.author: CINCPAC Staff
books.description: CINCPAC command summary covering the critical autumn months of 1942: continued Guadalcanal operations, naval battles in the Solomons, and the turning of the tide in the Pacific.

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 3
books.subtitle: 1 January 1943 to 30 June 1943
books.author: CINCPAC Staff
books.period_covered: Central Solomons and New Georgia campaigns
books.description: CINCPAC command summary covering the first half of 1943: continuing operations in the Solomons, New Georgia campaign, and planning for the Central Pacific offensive.

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 4
books.subtitle: 1 July 1943 to 31 December 1943
books.author: CINCPAC Staff
books.period_covered: Central Pacific offensive begins - Gilberts campaign
books.description: CINCPAC command summary covering the second half of 1943: launch of the Central Pacific drive, Tarawa, Makin, and the beginning of the island-hopping strategy.

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 5
books.subtitle: 1 January 1944 to 31 December 1944
books.author: CINCPAC Staff
books.description: CINCPAC command summary covering the decisive year of 1944: Marshalls campaign, Marianas Turkey Shoot, Saipan, Tinian, Guam, and MacArthur's return to the Philippines. The longest volume covering the year of greatest Pacific offensive momentum.

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 6
books.subtitle: 1 January 1945 to 1 July 1945
books.author: CINCPAC Staff
books.description: CINCPAC command summary covering the first half of 1945: Iwo Jima, Okinawa, the costly final campaigns approaching the Japanese home islands, and planning for the invasion of Japan.

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 7
books.subtitle: 1 July 1945 to 31 August 1945
books.author: CINCPAC Staff
books.description: CINCPAC command summary covering the war's end: final air and naval operations against Japan, atomic bomb decisions, Japanese surrender negotiations, and V-J Day. The concluding volume of the Pacific War narrative.

books.title: Command Summary of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, USN: Volume 8
books.subtitle: Selected Dispatches: 30 December 1941 to 30 April 1942 and the Battle of Midway
books.author: CINCPAC Staff
books.description: Special collection of dispatches from CINCPAC's files and COMINCH sealed secret files. Includes comprehensive dispatch coverage of the Battle of Midway and early war period communications. Note: Some portions of original dispatches were poorly reproduced and may be illegible.

production_notes.layout_strategy: Original 8x10.5 content centered within 8.5x11 page with 0.5 inch margins, background colors preserved full-bleed
production_notes.color_interior_required: Yes - original pages have varying colors (pink, green, white)
production_notes.volume_1_solution: Extract 50+ pages to Volume 0 (master TOC, commentary, indexes)
production_notes.ocr_improvement: Planned - estimated cost $50 using Claude vision API
